body:
hi @neuronflow , apologies for missing this.

To be clear, are you asking how to warp a T1 image to a T1 atlas (voxelmorph), or how you should do segmentation given an atlas (our MICCAI2019 paper on segmentation)?

Hi @adalca thanks for looking into this.

I have an atlas which provides me a T1 and T2 and multiple segmentation files.

My main goal is to segment my patients, so to warp these segmentation maps into patient space. Besides of that it would be interesting to warp the atlas T1 and T2 too.

Soo in my naive ANTs inspired thinking I thought therefore I best first warp atlas T1 into patient space, obtain the deformation field for this warp and use this to warp the segmentations.

@neuronflow are the patient scans T1 as well?

I would first recommend doing some training/fine-tuning of one of the vxm models.

To obtain the warp, please see an example in `test.py`. Essentially you:
- load the model (e.g.  `net = networks.cvpr2018_net(vol_size, nf_enc, nf_dec); net.load_weights(model_name);`) 
- the warp is the second output of the model. e.g. `[_, warp] = net.predict(data)`
- if you want to use the warp, please see `networks.nn_trf()` , and again see how it's used in `test.py`
@adalca hi, is the warp in physical space or image space? the unit of the warp is in mm? or not? thank you.

> @neuronflow are the patient scans T1 as well?
> 
> I would first recommend doing some training/fine-tuning of one of the vxm models.
> 
> To obtain the warp, please see an example in `test.py`. Essentially you:
> 
> * load the model (e.g.  `net = networks.cvpr2018_net(vol_size, nf_enc, nf_dec); net.load_weights(model_name);`)
> * the warp is the second output of the model. e.g. `[_, warp] = net.predict(data)`
> * if you want to use the warp, please see `networks.nn_trf()` , and again see how it's used in `test.py`

@adalca I think this could become part of register.py, so people can run it from command line. 

Would you like me to send a PR for this?
@adalca or a second command line, such as `applyWarp.py` specifically for this.

@armaneshaghi thanks for the idea -- we have this already in the new branch, see https://github.com/voxelmorph/voxelmorph/blob/redesign/scripts/tensorflow/warp.py

This will be released soon and will replace the current code structure.
